> Two: The mage levels (they're pretty easy to spot too) sometimes 
> crashed the game on my laptop, however, the game regularly crashes 
on 
> my laptop (it's old) i'm pretty sure they'll work fine on newer 
> computers. if not, no biggie, just restart the game. the second time 
> always proved to be the charm.

They crashed mine a couple of times.  Mine was purchased THIS year.  I 
have theories about keeping the game from crashing, though.  Doing 
things like allocuting more memory to the game generally helps.

Let me tell you a few things upfront that I learned:
1) ALWAYS give plenty of space to walk around.  If you have any doubt 
about space to walk around being too small, try sending a large slime 
or a fire elemental to walk through it.
2) repeat number 1.
3) if you are going to have super-powered characters, build up to that 
point.  You don't start off against experience level 12 or higher.  I 
have sent my 100% legitimate team through all built-in scenarios, all 
the tevfifty, and then I was able to start against some opponents.  
But I have had to build my way up to strong opponents.
4) time being frozen repeatedly isn't very fun.  Especially when there 
is a mage tower that can generate more mages that can freeze time.
